page.title: 08THE NATIONAL PEAK PARK
page.content: The Peak Park(the word Peak coming from the Old English word Peac meaning hill or knoll)was created in 1954 & covers an area of 542 sq.miles.The aim in its creation was to provide a rural area of great beauty as a recreation area for city folk & also to protect by means of bye_laws enforced by Park Rangers,this beautiful countryside. About 56 people,including 16 Rangers & 9 Planners are employed to run the Peak Park.This Park lies at the point where North & South meet & so both Northern & Southern plants can be found here:plants such as purple moor grass,bog asphodel,lichens,rushes & heather.Rare birds,such as Goshawks nest here & are protected by the Rangers.Many species of newt live in the valleys.
